title: 1999 Pan Pacific Swimming Championships – Women's 4 × 200 metre freestyle relay
text:
The women's 4 × 200 metre freestyle relay competition at the <a href="1999%20Pan%20Pacific%20Swimming%20Championships">1999 Pan Pacific Swimming Championships</a> took place on August 26 at the <a href="Sydney%20International%20Aquatic%20Centre">Sydney International Aquatic Centre</a>. The <a href="1997%20Pan%20Pacific%20Swimming%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%204%20%C3%97%20200%20metre%20freestyle%20relay">last</a> champion was the United States.
This race consisted of sixteen lengths of the pool. Each of the four swimmers completed four lengths of the pool. The first swimmer had to touch the wall before the second could leave the starting block.
Records.
Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan Pacific records were as follows:
Results.
All times are in minutes and seconds.
Heats.
Heats weren't performed, as only six teams had entered.
Final.
The final was held on August 22.
